p: While ranpirnase has an antiviral effect in vitro, effectiveness of this compound in vivo likely requires the ability to cross the BBB or novel delivery methods. A form of ranpirnase (Onconase for Injection) was rapidly distributed throughout the body and had a short serum half-life of 36.5 min [ 30]. However, the drug appears to remain active in the cell for up to 4 days [ 16]. In another study, a recombinant ranpirnase peptide was targeted to neurons when injected directly into the cerebrospinal fluid [ 31]. Further studies of ranpirnase activity in the CNS will be informative to understand the potential of TMR-001 as an antirabies therapy.
